org.apache.poi.util

Class BitField

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.poi.util.BitField

  • @Internal(since="POI 3.15 beta 3")
public class BitField
extends java.lang.Object
    Manage operations dealing with bit-mapped fields.(${t_068d16de2b9f4a17a95ff836690578d8})
    Author:
    Marc Johnson (mjohnson at apache dot org), Andrew C. Oliver (acoliver at apache dot org)

      Are all of the bits set or not? This is a stricter test than isSet, in that all of the bits in a multi-bit set must be set for this method to return true(${t_c6e9265c271649d4b8727ee8cec96e37})
      boolean isSet(int holder)
      Is the field set or not? This is most commonly used for a single-bit field, which is often used to represent a boolean value; the results of using it for a multi-bit field is to determine whether *any* of its bits are set(${t_9a46eabaa6b848b8a6636b540716bcc8})

      • BitField

        public BitField(int mask)
        Create a BitField instance(${t_d5fd6132895f4f48bd74863774c08614})
        Parameters:
        mask - the mask specifying which bits apply to this BitField. Bits that are set in this mask are the bits that this BitField operates on(${t_0c8297ccd67e45efab56acea3a29b750})

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public int getValue(int holder)
        Obtain the value for the specified BitField, appropriately shifted right. Many users of a BitField will want to treat the specified bits as an int value, and will not want to be aware that the value is stored as a BitField (and so shifted left so many bits)(${t_77d2389fae9147bbbfe5aa11293f7714})
        Parameters:
        holder - the int data containing the bits we're interested in(${t_35876b787d7141b69b0d115785ce888a})
        Returns:
        the selected bits, shifted right appropriately(${t_a940692cee5c45c5850fa9081177e7e9})

      • getShortValue

        public short getShortValue(short holder)
        Obtain the value for the specified BitField, appropriately shifted right, as a short. Many users of a BitField will want to treat the specified bits as an int value, and will not want to be aware that the value is stored as a BitField (and so shifted left so many bits)(${t_eec8bfecf2f046f7adc63fcb3d9c0087})
        Parameters:
        holder - the short data containing the bits we're interested in(${t_c0702c2353aa48cd80e2e017e36fa981})
        Returns:
        the selected bits, shifted right appropriately(${t_fae6b7e2ac7749ae87c35cb9103a4074})

      • isSet

        public boolean isSet(int holder)
        Is the field set or not? This is most commonly used for a single-bit field, which is often used to represent a boolean value; the results of using it for a multi-bit field is to determine whether *any* of its bits are set(${t_eaeb6a073df64bf7b5ba4f7b5eba4cb5})
        Parameters:
        holder - the int data containing the bits we're interested in(${t_9eba45f250dc44e58840426f06314583})
        Returns:
        true if any of the bits are set, else false(${t_6ee1c42c3cec48e0aaf8130f124c84a6})

      • isAllSet

        public boolean isAllSet(int holder)
        Are all of the bits set or not? This is a stricter test than isSet, in that all of the bits in a multi-bit set must be set for this method to return true(${t_20e157c4607940a6b131e2d84545a868})
        Parameters:
        holder - the int data containing the bits we're interested in(${t_010983ab13ac47b0aed24d6421ff3f8a})
        Returns:
        true if all of the bits are set, else false(${t_160e1f8fd80c4300b6a699d1df752847})
